info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 3:31AM CDT until October 25 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, northwestern Cherokee, Smith and Wood.
* WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tyler, Jacksonville, Whitehouse, Rusk, Mineola, Winnsboro, Lindale, Bullard, Quitman, Hawkins, Hoard, Hainesville, Golden, Mount Selman, Mixon, Reese, Pleasant Grove, Maydelle, Forest Hill and Noonday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Cherokee, TX; Smith, TX; Wood, TX
